ygData.subject: RE: Reports of GZ's test on Veeshan server last night
ygData.msgSnippet: Could be.  Either way since in the test I was not playing anything except Lullaby, unless it can have a duration shorter than one pulse no mobs should have
ygData.messageBody:
Could be. Either way since in the test I was not playing anything except
Lullaby, unless it can have a duration shorter than one pulse no mobs should
have been able to attack me if they failed to resist on the pulses. Not
that it would surprise me that Verant would nerf it to the point where the
song didn't even last for a whole pulse.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 12, 2000 12:40 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Reports of GZ's test on Veeshan server last night


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

The same way mobs sometimes hit you after they die?

>-----Original Message-----
>From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, January 12, 2000 11:02 AM

>On Wed, 12 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>>
>> A: attacked apparently immediately, though according to the
>logfile output 2
>> seconds later and always 2 seconds btw. or

>I saw this two nights ago with an enchanter's mesmerize. I
>saw the "mob is enthralled" message, the mob got in a double
>attack on the enchanter, then it stood mesmerized and the
>enchanter walked away. So I think most of these immediate
>attacks are just a result of the messages coming out of order.
